TopicTitle: In honor of the 50th Anniversary, this week’s...

Articles.Content:
In honor of the 50th Anniversary, this week’s #KSPChallenge is to recreate the Apollo 12 Mission. 

For those up to the challenge, we wish you a safe launch, landing and lightning strike free journey to the Mun!We’re excited to see you replicate both the launch that took place on Nov 14th as well as EVA’s throughout the mission and the splashdown landing on Nov 24th!

We’ll be sharing and featuring your posts so be sure to tag your in-game footage + screenshots with #KSPApollo12

I have not really been playing, This is the perfect mission to get back into the groove of l̶i̶t̶h̶o̶b̶r̶a̶k̶i̶n̶g̶  landing on the moon

Edited November 11, 2019 by lapis
What do you mean by recreating it? Do you want us to have Surveyor 3's spacecraft in it as well?

And who is going to be the “Steely eyed missle man”?

Edited November 11, 2019 by linuxgurugamer

1. Can the Realism Overhaul emulate the double electric shock in hard mode?
Or there is a stock option?
Maybe use UPS wires?

2. What is KSP default shortcut for "SCE to AUX" ?
Or should we assign it an action group?

Edited November 11, 2019 by kerbiloid

Heeeey! The KSP Challenges are back!

I'll probably pass on this one, since I've done countless Apollo-style missions already, but it's good to see them return!
I've been fine tuning a fresh Yankee Clipper for the occasion, will post later.

A little late but here is my entry

My favorite is the SII Separation. I redesigned the SIVB for this build, that's probably the most significant change from my Apollo 11 build.
